amendment.description: To require the Attorney General of the United States to grant certain requests by State attorneys general to cross designate State and local attorneys to prosecute individuals for sex trafficking.

vote.text: Amendment SA 279 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 279 proposed by Senator Cornyn for Senator Sullivan. (consideration: CR S2333-2337; text: CR S2334) To require the Attorney General of the United States to grant certain requests by State attorneys general to cross designate State and local attorneys to prosecute individuals for sex trafficking.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 279 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 279 proposed by Senator Cornyn for Senator Sullivan.
